00037 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LOV
00038 
00039 #include <libcfs/libcfs.h>
00040 
00041 #include <obd_class.h>
00042 
00043 #include "lov_internal.h"
00044 
00045 /* compute object size given "stripeno" and the ost size */
00046 u64 lov_stripe_size(struct lov_stripe_md *lsm, u64 ost_size, int stripeno)
00047 {
00048         unsigned long ssize = lsm->lsm_stripe_size;
00049         unsigned long stripe_size;
00050         loff_t swidth;
00051         loff_t lov_size;
00052         u32 magic = lsm->lsm_magic;
00053         ENTRY;
00054 
00055         if (ost_size == 0)
00056                 RETURN(0);
00057 
00058         LASSERT(lsm_op_find(magic) != NULL);
00059         lsm_op_find(magic)->lsm_stripe_by_index(lsm, &stripeno, NULL, &swidth);
00060 
00061         /* lov_do_div64(a, b) returns a % b, and a = a / b */
00062         stripe_size = lov_do_div64(ost_size, ssize);
00063         if (stripe_size)
00064                 lov_size = ost_size * swidth + stripeno * ssize + stripe_size;
00065         else
00066                 lov_size = (ost_size - 1) * swidth + (stripeno + 1) * ssize;
00067 
00068         RETURN(lov_size);
00069 }
00070 
00074 pgoff_t lov_stripe_pgoff(struct lov_stripe_md *lsm, pgoff_t stripe_index,
00075                          int stripe)
00076 {
00077         loff_t offset;
00078 
00079         offset = lov_stripe_size(lsm, (stripe_index << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT) + 1,
00080                                  stripe);
00081         return offset >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00082 }
00083 
00084 /* we have an offset in file backed by an lov and want to find out where
00085  * that offset lands in our given stripe of the file.  for the easy
00086  * case where the offset is within the stripe, we just have to scale the
00087  * offset down to make it relative to the stripe instead of the lov.
00088  *
00089  * the harder case is what to do when the offset doesn't intersect the
00090  * stripe.  callers will want start offsets clamped ahead to the start
00091  * of the nearest stripe in the file.  end offsets similarly clamped to the
00092  * nearest ending byte of a stripe in the file:
00093  *
00094  * all this function does is move offsets to the nearest region of the
00095  * stripe, and it does its work "mod" the full length of all the stripes.
00096  * consider a file with 3 stripes:
00097  *
00098  *             S                                              E
00099  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00100  * |    0    |     1     |     2     |    0    |     1     |     2     |
00101  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00102  *
00103  * to find stripe 1's offsets for S and E, it divides by the full stripe
00104  * width and does its math in the context of a single set of stripes:
00105  *
00106  *             S         E
00107  * -----------------------------------
00108  * |    0    |     1     |     2     |
00109  * -----------------------------------
00110  *
00111  * it'll notice that E is outside stripe 1 and clamp it to the end of the
00112  * stripe, then multiply it back out by lov_off to give the real offsets in
00113  * the stripe:
00114  *
00115  *   S                   E
00116  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00117  * |    1    |     1     |     1     |    1    |     1     |     1     |
00118  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00119  *
00120  * it would have done similarly and pulled S forward to the start of a 1
00121  * stripe if, say, S had landed in a 0 stripe.
00122  *
00123  * this rounding isn't always correct.  consider an E lov offset that lands
00124  * on a 0 stripe, the "mod stripe width" math will pull it forward to the
00125  * start of a 1 stripe, when in fact it wanted to be rounded back to the end
00126  * of a previous 1 stripe.  this logic is handled by callers and this is why:
00127  *
00128  * this function returns < 0 when the offset was "before" the stripe and
00129  * was moved forward to the start of the stripe in question;  0 when it
00130  * falls in the stripe and no shifting was done; > 0 when the offset
00131  * was outside the stripe and was pulled back to its final byte. */
00132 int lov_stripe_offset(struct lov_stripe_md *lsm, loff_t lov_off, int stripeno,
00133                       loff_t *obdoff)
00134 {
00135         unsigned long ssize  = lsm->lsm_stripe_size;
00136         loff_t stripe_off;
00137         loff_t this_stripe;
00138         loff_t swidth;
00139         u32 magic = lsm->lsm_magic;
00140         int ret = 0;
00141 
00142         if (lov_off == OBD_OBJECT_EOF) {
00143                 *obdoff = OBD_OBJECT_EOF;
00144                 return 0;
00145         }
00146 
00147         LASSERT(lsm_op_find(magic) != NULL);
00148         lsm_op_find(magic)->lsm_stripe_by_index(lsm, &stripeno, &lov_off,
00149                                                 &swidth);
00150 
00151         /* lov_do_div64(a, b) returns a % b, and a = a / b */
00152         stripe_off = lov_do_div64(lov_off, swidth);
00153 
00154         this_stripe = (loff_t)stripeno * ssize;
00155         if (stripe_off < this_stripe) {
00156                 stripe_off = 0;
00157                 ret = -1;
00158         } else {
00159                 stripe_off -= this_stripe;
00160 
00161                 if (stripe_off >= ssize) {
00162                         stripe_off = ssize;
00163                         ret = 1;
00164                 }
00165         }
00166 
00167         *obdoff = lov_off * ssize + stripe_off;
00168         return ret;
00169 }
00170 
00171 /* Given a whole-file size and a stripe number, give the file size which
00172  * corresponds to the individual object of that stripe.
00173  *
00174  * This behaves basically in the same was as lov_stripe_offset, except that
00175  * file sizes falling before the beginning of a stripe are clamped to the end
00176  * of the previous stripe, not the beginning of the next:
00177  *
00178  *                                               S
00179  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00180  * |    0    |     1     |     2     |    0    |     1     |     2     |
00181  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00182  *
00183  * if clamped to stripe 2 becomes:
00184  *
00185  *                                   S
00186  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00187  * |    0    |     1     |     2     |    0    |     1     |     2     |
00188  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------
00189  */
00190 loff_t lov_size_to_stripe(struct lov_stripe_md *lsm, u64 file_size,
00191                           int stripeno)
00192 {
00193         unsigned long ssize  = lsm->lsm_stripe_size;
00194         loff_t stripe_off;
00195         loff_t this_stripe;
00196         loff_t swidth;
00197         u32 magic = lsm->lsm_magic;
00198 
00199         if (file_size == OBD_OBJECT_EOF)
00200                 return OBD_OBJECT_EOF;
00201 
00202         LASSERT(lsm_op_find(magic) != NULL);
00203         lsm_op_find(magic)->lsm_stripe_by_index(lsm, &stripeno, &file_size,
00204                                                 &swidth);
00205 
00206         /* lov_do_div64(a, b) returns a % b, and a = a / b */
00207         stripe_off = lov_do_div64(file_size, swidth);
00208 
00209         this_stripe = (loff_t)stripeno * ssize;
00210         if (stripe_off < this_stripe) {
00211                 /* Move to end of previous stripe, or zero */
00212                 if (file_size > 0) {
00213                         file_size--;
00214                         stripe_off = ssize;
00215                 } else {
00216                         stripe_off = 0;
00217                 }
00218         } else {
00219                 stripe_off -= this_stripe;
00220 
00221                 if (stripe_off >= ssize) {
00222                         /* Clamp to end of this stripe */
00223                         stripe_off = ssize;
00224                 }
00225         }
00226 
00227         return (file_size * ssize + stripe_off);
00228 }
00229 
00230 /* given an extent in an lov and a stripe, calculate the extent of the stripe
00231  * that is contained within the lov extent.  this returns true if the given
00232  * stripe does intersect with the lov extent. */
00233 int lov_stripe_intersects(struct lov_stripe_md *lsm, int stripeno,
00234                           loff_t start, loff_t end,
00235                           loff_t *obd_start, loff_t *obd_end)
00236 {
00237         int start_side, end_side;
00238 
00239         start_side = lov_stripe_offset(lsm, start, stripeno, obd_start);
00240         end_side = lov_stripe_offset(lsm, end, stripeno, obd_end);
00241 
00242         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "["LPD64"->"LPD64"] -> [(%d) "LPD64"->"LPD64" (%d)]\n",
00243                 start, end, start_side, *obd_start, *obd_end, end_side);
00244 
00245         /* this stripe doesn't intersect the file extent when neither
00246          * start or the end intersected the stripe and obd_start and
00247          * obd_end got rounded up to the save value. */
00248         if (start_side != 0 && end_side != 0 && *obd_start == *obd_end)
00249                 return 0;
00250 
00251         /* as mentioned in the lov_stripe_offset commentary, end
00252          * might have been shifted in the wrong direction.  This
00253          * happens when an end offset is before the stripe when viewed
00254          * through the "mod stripe size" math. we detect it being shifted
00255          * in the wrong direction and touch it up.
00256          * interestingly, this can't underflow since end must be > start
00257          * if we passed through the previous check.
00258          * (should we assert for that somewhere?) */
00259         if (end_side != 0)
00260                 (*obd_end)--;
00261 
00262         return 1;
00263 }
00264 
00265 /* compute which stripe number "lov_off" will be written into */
00266 int lov_stripe_number(struct lov_stripe_md *lsm, loff_t lov_off)
00267 {
00268         unsigned long ssize  = lsm->lsm_stripe_size;
00269         loff_t stripe_off;
00270         loff_t swidth;
00271         u32 magic = lsm->lsm_magic;
00272 
00273         LASSERT(lsm_op_find(magic) != NULL);
00274         lsm_op_find(magic)->lsm_stripe_by_offset(lsm, NULL, &lov_off, &swidth);
00275 
00276         stripe_off = lov_do_div64(lov_off, swidth);
00277 
00278         /* Puts stripe_off/ssize result into stripe_off */
00279         lov_do_div64(stripe_off, ssize);
00280 
00281         return stripe_off;
00282 }
